Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Sofia Sequenzia Papers on Hugo Gellert
Sequenzia, Sofia
Gellert, Hugo, 1892-1985
TAM.717
.25 Linear Feet in 1 half manuscript box
3 audiocassettes
1981-1986 Materials are in English. This collection contains three audio cassette tapes of a 1981 interview by Sofia Sequenzia with muralist and illustrator Hugo Gellert. Sequenzia conducted a three-hour interview with Gellert for a freelance article she published in the National Guardian. The audio recordings of the interview appear to be incomplete and are on 3 tapes numbered 1, 4, and 6. The interview is accompanied by Sequenzia's notes and a handwritten transcript. The collection also includes flyers, programs, and articles from events dedicated to Gellert's life and works. 1
Conditions Governing Access
Open to users without restrictions.
Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
Researchers interested in using audiovisual materials in this collection (films, cassette tapes, VHS tapes, et cetera) must use a digitized copy, which we refer to as an access copy. Researchers may view an item’s original container, but the media themselves are not available for playback because of preservation concerns. Materials that have already been digitized are noted in the collection’s finding aid and can be requested in our reading room; materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. These requests are free of charge and can be made in anticipation of your visit. The process typically takes four to six weeks. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A librarian will respond to you with further information.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Sofia Sequenzia in June 2016. The accession number associated with this gift is 2017.009.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Sofia Sequenzia Papers on Hugo Gellert; TAM 717; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Content Description
This collection contains three audio cassette tapes of a 1981 interview with artist Hugo Gellert conducted by Sofia Sequenzia. The audio recordings of the interview appear to be incomplete and are on 3 tapes numbered 1, 4, and 6. The interview is accompanied by Sequenzia's notes and a handwritten transcript. The collection also includes flyers, programs, and articles from events dedicated to Gellert's life and works.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Sofia Sequenzia, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in 2016 by Sofia Sequenzia. These materials are governed by a Creative Commons CC0 license. Users need not secure permission from the Tamiment library to publish or reproduce materials in this collection.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were moved into archival housing and described in a collection-level finding aid.
Biographical / Historical
Sophia Sequenzia conducted a three-hour interview with muralist and illustrator Hugo Gellert in 1981, which she used for a freelance article published in the National Guardian.
Hugo Gellert was a communist graphic artist whose work appeared in a number of radical publications including the Masses, the Liberator, and the New Masses. His is most well-known for his depictions of working-class struggle and artwork supporting organized labor.
